SENT.plain: Recently there has been increasing interest in the non-motor functions of the globus pallidus, and especially its role in cognitive processing
We experienced two patients with acute cognitive and behavior changes after globus pallidus infarctions
Examination of both revealed inattention, decreased verbal fluency, emotional blunting, and amnesia
There were no other sensory or motor symptoms
Brain magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed focal acute cerebral infarction in the left globus pallidus
Neuropsychological assessment revealed decreased frontal executive function, with verbal memory disturbance
These cases suggest that strategic infarction dementia can result from a single globus pallidus lesion
